title: API Index
content:
#

This section summarizes the APIs provided by BubblesJS:

 * @bubblesjs/utils
   * getRequest(option): returns an Axios instance with unified status code
     handling, error messaging and unauthorized callbacks
   * createRequest(option): create an Axios instance with customizable
     interceptors

More packages and APIs are coming soon.

title: Guide
content:
#

Welcome to the BubblesJS Guide! This section takes you from zero to one:

 * Environment requirements and installation
 * Create projects with create-bubbles (React / Vue)
 * Development and preview
 * Production build and deployment
 * Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

Now, let's start with the Start section~

title: Quick Start
content:
#

Getting started with BubblesJS is easy! Let's create your first project.


Environment Requirements#

 * Node.js >= 18.0.0
 * Package manager: npm, yarn, pnpm, or bun


Create Project#

You can use create-bubbles to create a new BubblesJS project:




Choose Template#

During project creation, you'll be prompted to select a template:

 * React + Rsbuild: Fast React development with Rsbuild
 * Vue + Rsbuild: Vue development with Rsbuild and auto-imports
 * Vue + Vite: Traditional Vue + Vite setup
 * Vue + Rolldown + Oxlint: Experimental build tools (Rolldown + Oxlint)


Start Development#

After project creation, navigate to your project directory and start the
development server:




Project Structure#




Next Steps#

 * ðŸŽ¯ Learn about Templates - Explore available project templates
 * ðŸ“¦ Packages Documentation - Discover utility packages
 * ðŸ”§ API Reference - Check out available APIs

Happy coding! ðŸš€

title: Hello World!
content:
#


Start#

title: Packages
content:
#

BubblesJS currently includes the following packages:

 * @bubblesjs/utils: Axios-based request wrapper and helper utilities
 * create-bubbles: Project scaffolding for React/Vue with multiple build
   templates
 * create-bubbles-rslib: Library project template powered by Rslib

Use the left navigation to view details of each package.

title: @bubblesjs/utils
content:
#

Axios-based request wrapper for common request scenarios.


Install#




Quick Usage#




API#


getRequest(option)#

 * baseUrl: string, default '/'
 * timeout: number, default 0
 * commonHeaders: Record string>
 * successMessageFunc: (message: string) => void
 * errorMessageFunc: (message: string) => void
 * unAuthorizedResponseFunc: (message: string) => void
 * statusMap: { success?: number; unAuthorized?: number }
 * codeMap: { success?: number[]; unAuthorized?: number[] }
 * responseDataKey: string, default 'data'
 * responseMessageKey: string, default 'message'
 * isTransformResponse: boolean, default true
 * isShowSuccessMessage: boolean, default true


Advanced: Custom Axios instance#

title: Templates
content:
#

create-bubbles provides the following templates to help you get started quickly:

 * React + Rsbuild (recommended)
 * Vue + Rsbuild
 * Vue + Vite
 * Vue + Rolldown + Oxlint (experimental)

Use the left navigation to view each template's usage and features.

title: React + Rsbuild
content:
#

Preset includes:

 * @rsbuild/core + @rsbuild/plugin-react
 * UnoCSS, Sass, SVGR
 * Auto Import (react, react-router)


Run#




Important files#

 * rsbuild.config.ts: build config
 * src/router/index.tsx: router config
 * src/layout/default: base layout

title: Vue + Rolldown + Oxlint (Experimental)
content:
#

This template integrates Rolldown and Oxlint for faster builds and stronger
static analysis.


Run#




Notes#

This template is experimental and may be less stable than Rsbuild/Vite. Choose
according to your needs.

title: Vue + Rsbuild
content:
#

Preset includes:

 * @rsbuild/core + @rsbuild/plugin-vue
 * UnoCSS, Sass
 * Auto Import (vue, vue-router)


Run#




Important files#

 * rsbuild.config.ts: build config
 * src/router: router config & entry
 * src/layout: base layout

title: Vue + Vite
content:
#

Preset includes:

 * Vite + @vitejs/plugin-vue
 * TypeScript + vue-tsc


Run#




Important files#

 * vite.config.ts: build config
 * src/main.ts: entry
 * src/App.vue: root component
